snippet: Citing financial problems, Summer Reese, interim director of the station, said, “We will be laying off virtually everyone whose voice you recognize on the air.”
abstract: Media Decoder blog; noncommercial radio station WBAI-FM, liberal fixture in New York for more than 50 years, lays off two-thirds of its staff, citing long-simmering financial problems.
lead_paragraph: Citing financial problems, Summer Reese, interim director of the station, said, “We will be laying off virtually everyone whose voice you recognize on the air.”

headline.main: WBAI-FM Lays Off Most of Staff
